text: Sorry if I am missing something, but experimenting with dnd areas (I have been on leave and just getting back into all the hs improvements)
if I pick a template with a dnd area, seems i can’t select any other templates now. is this intentional?
I created a page with a dnd area in the template, and now if I want to change the template to another one, non are available
this also works in reverse. if I pick a template without dnd area, then if I want to switch to one with, not possible. they don’t show in available templates

<@UEC65BQV8> that's really weird. from what I can tell via docs, the concept of "drag and drop" is pretty concrete. so less about `dnd_area` specifically and more that it uses `dnd` stuffs. Subsequently by making a page off of a dnd base, it's that "type" forever, and vice versa.

Just learning the templating language... I can not get `horizontal_alignment` to work for the life of me. Can't get a `dnd_module` that isn't a full 12 cells wide to center in a row. What am I missing?
neither `offset` nor `horizontal_alignment` seems to center anything

More on this... if I have `horizontal_alignment='CENTER'` on `dnd_module` just like it says via the documentation, I can't seem to get the cells to horizontally center. If I simply add the `justify-content:center` attribute, it will do it. So I'm messing something up on my HubL code and I'm not sure what I'm missing to get these flex columns to center align. Thanks!
